page.title: 11ECOLOGY
page.content: The agricultural land is well-cared for an in good heart. Footpaths and bridle-paths are well-signposted and accessible to hikers, riders and anyone interested in the natural history of the area. The flora associaed with chalky soil and woodland survives in abundance despite modern methods of weed control and includes large colonies f the disappearing cowslip. The woodland provides cover for the deer which are culled but no longer hunted. Smaller mammals such as fox and badger thrive. Pheasants are reared on the edge of many of the woods and frequent shoots are held during the open season. Rough shooting is popular as a method of controlling the large numbers of rabbits.
